report_title: Online Handbag & Luggage Sales in the US
executive_summary: Online handbag and luggage stores are enjoying strong revenue growth driven by rising e-commerce activity. The convenience, selection breadth and price-competitiveness online platforms give consumers are hard for traditional brick-and-mortar stores to compete with, and the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic made the industry the only option for most consumers. While industry revenue dipped in 2020 as consumer confidence plummeted, strong growth in consumer spending in the years since has promoted sales of discretionary items and more than made up for previous losses. Because of strong pre- and post-pandemic expansion, industry-wide revenue has been growing at a CAGR of 6.0% over the past five years and is expected to total $2.1 billion in 2023, when revenue will jump by an estimated 2.6%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Shopping Is On The Rise
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Technological advancements and the proliferation of mobile devices have amplified the effects of online shopping on consumer behavior. Internet access has become almost as ubiquitous as access to water or electricity, and mobile internet connections have overtaken in-home

E-commerce platforms saw a surge in demand during the COVID-19 pandemic as retailers temporarily closed or reduced capacity while consumer concerns about social distancing supported e-commerce platforms. E-commerce sales continued to jump year over year in the aftermath of the pandemic as consumers sought the convenience and array of products online platforms offer.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumer Spending Spiked Following The Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumer spending dipped in 2020 as the pandemic heavily cut consumer confidence, but a spike in 2021 more than made up for the previous year's decline. Strong growth in consumer spending throughout the period has promoted discretionary purchases, like handbags and luggage. Consumer access to credit has expanded as well, enabling customers to put premium luxury handbags on their credit card.

With low to medium barriers to entry and the potential for dropshipping, new entrants have flooded the industry in an effort to service rising consumer preference for e-commerce. The influx of new online stores has come with heightened employment that has pushed down per-employee pay.

Websites that are made with desktop computers in mind don't always work well on smartphones. Mobile phones are becoming an essential part of e-commerce, leading to what many call m-commerce. By adapting existing websites for m-commerce, online handbag and luggage stores are staying relevant with changing consumer buying habits.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consumer Sentiment Recovers And Spending Continues
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer confidence is expected to rebound after major declines through the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 and widespread inflation in 2022 and 2023. Returning consumer confidence will promote discretionary spending, lifting sales of premium luggage and handbags.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Social Commerce And Influencer Collaboration Promotes Large Companies
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Online retailers are integrating with social media apps like Instagram to give consumers the ability to purchase a bag without ever leaving the app. While much of the responsibility for marketing lies with upstream manufacturers seeking to upgrade their brand's image, the growing trend of influencer collaboration will shape what products online retailers need to offer. Large companies that have existing relationships with luxury brands like Gucci and Louis Vuitton will be better poised to take advantage of the growing influence of social media personalities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: High-Margin Items Will Promote Profit Expansion
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As premium handbags and suitcases become more popular with consumers, online stores will enjoy significant markups. Because of the power the brand's name holds, consumers are willing to pay high prices for luxury handbags. High-margin items and year-over-year increases in revenue will promote the expansion of the industry's profit, though competition may temper profit growth.

New entrants, especially online-only dropshippers, will continue flooding the market over the next five years. Strong growth in e-commerce sales will sustain the influx of new online handbag and luggage retailers for now, but the trend is simply unsustainable. The industry will continue to barrel toward market saturation over the next five years, though stable pricing models have buoyed online stores from intense price competition.

industry_definition: This industry sells handbags, wallets and other leather goods on the internet. This includes online-only retailers as well as brick-and-mortar stores that have an online presence.
key_trends: Technological advancements and the proliferation of mobile devices have amplified the effects of online shopping on consumer behavior
Strong growth in consumer spending throughout the period has promoted discretionary purchases, like handbags and luggage
By adapting existing websites for m-commerce, online handbag and luggage stores are staying relevant with changing consumer buying habits
Consumer confidence is expected to rebound after major declines through the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 and widespread inflation in 2022 and 2023
Online retailers are integrating with social media apps like Instagram to give consumers the ability to purchase a bag without ever leaving the app

market_segmentation.segment_description: Younger consumers are more tech-savvy than older ones, making them much more likely to use online sites to buy products. While this segment is also often fashion-conscious, most sales come from those between 25 and 34 who have more disposable income to spend on premium discretionary items, like handbags or luggage.

Consumers in this segment are also likely to use online retailers, though may first try "showrooming", the practice of examining a product in a brick-and-mortar store before looking for it online at a lower price. A desire for fashionable yet practical accessories is evident among consumers aged 35 to 54, as they seek handbags and luggage that offer a balance between aesthetics and functionality, like laptop compartments and organizational features.

market_segmentation.segment: Consumers Over 55 are Less Comfortable with Online Sales
market_segmentation.segment_description: While older consumers that haven't grown up with the Internet are less likely to use e-commerce, demand for good quality handbags and luggage rises with age. By age 55, people are likely to have found a brand of handbag they are loyal to, and therefore, demand for designer bags is likely to be higher. Additionally, many people choose to travel during their retirement and will have greater demand for luggage.

products_and_services.product_description: Luxury and designer handbags account for the majority of revenue in this segment, which brings in nearly two-thirds of the industry's revenue. Consumers often own multiple handbags and frequently replace them for different occasions and to match different outfits.

This category includes suitcases, carry-on bags and other bags used for travel. Most customers look for high-quality and durable luggage because of the frequency of use and harsh handling they often face.
Online handbag and luggage stores also sell crossbody bags, laptop cases, briefcases and wallets.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for handbags is largely driven by disposable income levels and fashion trends. Luxury handbags carry high price tags, so as disposable income levels increase, so does demand for these items. Additionally, the ever-shifting nature of fashion often leads to bags going out of style and creating demand for new handbags.

Meanwhile, demand for e-commerce is driven by the presence of the internet and convenience. Consumers look to online retailers if they aren't willing or able to travel to brick-and-mortar stores, which was especially relevant through the COVID-19 pandemic. Additionally, online retailers often offer discounts and sales that can allow customers to purchase bags at relatively low prices.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Online handbag and luggage sales companies don't participate in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: Similar to many other e-commerce industries, online handbag and luggage sales companies are mainly based in California and the rest of the West region of the United States. The West is home to a pool of digital marketing experts, SEO specialists and social media influencers who can help online handbag and luggage sales companies establish a strong online presence and effectively target their desired audience. Many of the products sold by the industry are manufactured in Asian countries, so the ports in the West make the region very attractive to online retailers. Consumers in the West also often have high disposable income, which makes them more able to buy luxury handbags and luggage.

Online Retailers Don't Align With Population Trends. Business centers that operate websites and order-fulfillment facilities don't necessarily need to be close to downstream consumers, so the industry's distribution isn't closely tied to population trends. Still, many have fulfillment centers in dense metropolitan areas to minimize delivery times.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The CPSC sets safety standards for consumer products, including luggage and handbags.
The FTC regulates advertising and marketing practices to prevent deceptive or misleading claims.
Online retailers are subject to state sales tax regulations, which vary across states.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Revenue volatility level is high, which increases barriers to entry.
The industry is in the growth life cycle stage, which decreases barriers to entry.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition based on product quality, style, price for manufacturers
basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers that operate their own online sales platforms compete based on the quality, style and price of their products.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition based on product selection and price for large sellers
basis_points.basis_description: Large online sellers that offer multiple brands compete on price and the number of products available.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition based on user-friendly platform, price, inventory, brand awareness
basis_points.basis_description: Within the industry, smaller operators compete with large establishments on the bases of a user-friendly online shopping platform, price, inventory and brand awareness.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Major companies secure essential supplier contracts
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry's largest companies have solid relationships with the best-selling handbag and luggage brands, giving them an advantage.
The emergence of 'dropshipping' and other online-only distribution methods has begun to push down concentration by allowing smaller companies to compete.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Many Online Sales Companies Purchase Their Inventory
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Online handbag and luggage sellers typically purchase their inventory from wholesalers at reduced rates, from which online retailers can derive a market-based markup on their products.
While extremely volatile, the price of leather has slightly declined over the past five years.
Disruptions in the global supply chain, like transportation delays, raw material shortages or labor issues, can significantly impact online luggage and handbag retailers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: For every $1.00 spent on wages, online retailers will spend $0.10 in capital investment in 2023.
The industry relies heavily on labor, as skilled workers are necessary for building and maintaining an e-commerce platform.
The industry's main investments are warehouse space and computer equipment that ensure orders get fulfilled on time and as efficiently as possible.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consumer Spending and Preference Impact Revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Economic factors, shifts in consumer preferences or unforeseen events can influence consumer demand for discretionary purchases, like handbags and luggage.
While the price of leather and other key inputs can vary from year to year, the industry benefits from a reliable cost structure.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Supply Chain Issues Have Upped Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Still, the price of leather was unusually volatile over the past five years, skyrocketing in 2021 and lifting luggage and handbag prices.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online handbag and luggage sales companies have avoided heavy technological disruption over the past five years, as e-commerce itself is a disruption of traditional brick-and-mortar retail.
Still, the emergence of online-only retailers has begun to threaten some operations.
Most recently, online handbag and luggage companies have invested in mobile technology as a growing number of customers have shifted toward shopping through their mobile devices.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Levels of consumer sentiment determine consumers' willingness to purchase handbags and luggage. A downturn in the economy will result in less air travel and less demand for luggage.

FAQs.question: Are your customers heavily price-conscious? How do you attract price-conscious consumers?
FAQs.answer: Customers seek to maximize value with the purchase of luggage since it must be durable to withstand travel. Consumers are also price-conscious, yet to a lesser extent as handbags can be seen as a status symbol.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: Rising input costs are not substantial enough to greatly impact industry sales as most effects are reflected at the manufacturing and wholesaling levels. Leather prices are the most influential for online platforms as leather is a key input in many of the industry's handbags.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Some large companies will contract with manufacturers because of scale and volume. Meanwhile, some manufacturers and popular brands (like Away luggage) sell products on their own platforms, keeping the company vertically integrated and reducing overhead costs. Small, nonemployers don't often contract with manufacturers because their orders are not big enough.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to ensure that the most popular products are kept in stock?
FAQs.answer: Online retailers do not use POS systems as retail sites have built-in stock-keeping apps to ensure tracking. Operators must ensure these systems are kept up to date.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years? How does your company manage your e-commerce platform?
FAQs.answer: Some online stores outsource some operations to improve profitability. Online retailers outsource website building or use website building platforms, like Squarespace.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently? How has profitability been affected by the pandemic?
FAQs.answer: This industry faces little regulatory oversight. However, the industry's leading companies primarily operate as department stores, which contended with severe regulations during the pandemic as they were not deemed essential businesses and forced to temporarily close and reduce in-store capacity. As these companies struggled with overall profitability because of bricks-and-mortar expenses, they expanded e-commerce platforms to continue to generate revenue and boost profit.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests? How have trade associations assisted your company during the pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Many companies are incentivized to keep up with trade associations. Trade associations keep operators up-to-date on industry trends and suppliers.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for cash flow seasonality? How has this been affected by the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Companies will order more stock in preparation for the holidays. During off-seasons, companies may offer sales to clear inventory.

FAQs.question: How has your company's profit margin been impacted by the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: As bricks-and-mortar retailers turned to e-commerce platforms to generate revenue, profitability has remained high.

FAQs.question: What new technologies can you leverage to make your storefront and products more competitive? How often do you update your website?
FAQs.answer: Companies that are able to adapt to changing consumer technology stand to benefit in this industry. Companies need to update their websites frequently to ensure the displayed products have sufficient inventory.

FAQs.question: How do you generate interest in your site? What forms of advertising are most effective for your target demographic?
FAQs.answer: Small companies can quickly grow in this industry if they have strategic marketing. The proliferation of social media platforms and the expansion of social media shopping features (like Facebook Shops) has made e-commerce platforms

FAQs.question: How do you keep relationships with your key suppliers strong? What brands are you interested in carrying, and how can you entice them to your store?
FAQs.answer: Companies that can secure contracts with luxury brands are likely to generate higher demand. As e-commerce is highly competitive, ensuring high-quality product offerings can further entice customers.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? What price-premium products do you offer or are currently researching?
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income indicates consumer willingness to spend on discretionary purchases in particular. As per capita disposable income increases, demand for luggage and handbags will also climb as consumers will be more willing to make such discretionary purchases.

FAQs.question: How is your business affected by the number of broadband connections? How can you cater to the broadband market?
FAQs.answer: The more access consumers have to internet connections, the more they shop online. Broadband connections have now become widespread and relatively cheap to procure. As access to broadband increases, demand for e-commerce services increases.

FAQs.question: How have low levels of disposable income and consumer spending affected your company? How can you capitalize on rising spending?
FAQs.answer: Consumer spending reflects consumer expenditure on both discretionary and nondiscretionary purchases. An increase in consumer spending signals rising consumer demand for discretionary products, like handbags and luggage.
